title: England
summary: England is a country that is part of the United Kingdom. It shares land borders with Wales to the west and Scotland to the north-northwest.

value.label: The earliest known occupation of Britain by humans was during the old stone age. This huge period saw many changes in the environment, including the ice ages that greatly affecting human settlement in the region.
During the Neolithic era a more settled way of life was introduced although only a few actual settlement sites are known in Britain.

It is generally thought that by 500 BC most people inhabiting the British Isles were speaking Common Brythonic. Iron Age Britons lived in organised tribal groups, ruled by a chieftain. As people became more numerous, wars broke out between opposing tribes.

When England emerged from the collapse of the Roman Empire, the economy was in tatters and many of the towns abandoned. A rich artistic culture flourished under the Anglo-Saxons. They converted to Christianity in the 7th century and a network of monasteries and convents was built across England.

sections.title: Government
sections.label: As part of the United Kingdom, the basic political system in England is a constitutional monarchy and parliamentary system.

value.label: Ian Duncan Burnett, Baron Burnett of Maldon, PC

image.altText: Picture of Ian Duncan Burnett, Baron Burnett of Maldon, PC

value.label: England includes the central and southern two-thirds of the island of Great Britain, plus some offshore islands. It is bordered by Scotland to the north, and Wales to the west.

value.label: Many ancient standing stone monuments were erected during the prehistoric period, including the Stonehenge. Romans who founded the first cities and towns such as London and introduced elaborate buildings. Medieval architecture's buildings were simple constructions. Since the 1930s various modernist forms have appeared.

image.altText: Many ancient standing stone monuments were erected during the prehistoric period, including the Stonehenge. Romans who founded the first cities and towns such as London and introduced elaborate buildings. Medieval architecture's buildings were simple constructions. Since the 1930s various modernist forms have appeared.

value.label: Early authors wrote in Latin. The period of Old English literature provided the epic poem Beowulf. Middle English literature emerged with Geoffrey Chaucer, author of The Canterbury Tales. William Shakespeare, whose works include Hamlet, Romeo and Juliet, and Macbeth remains one of the most championed authors in English literature.

image.altText: Early authors wrote in Latin. The period of Old English literature provided the epic poem Beowulf. Middle English literature emerged with Geoffrey Chaucer, author of The Canterbury Tales. William Shakespeare, whose works include Hamlet, Romeo and Juliet, and Macbeth remains one of the most championed authors in English literature.

value.label: Traditional folk music of England is centuries old. Early English composers in classical music include Renaissance artists. In popular music, many English artists have been cited as the most influential musicians of all time, like The Beatles, Led Zeppelin, Pink Floyd, Elton John, and Queen.
